One of the worst games I've played in VR so far, no wonder it was free. 


Basically, the game is all about who can spawn kill the quickest. The maps are broken into 5 different scenes, where you'll be attacking or defending, if you're defending the goal is to spawn kill the enemies 3-5 times each. If you do this then you've defended. If you're attacking the impossible objective is to spawn and instantly try to not die by the defenders spawn killing.

The player positions are fixed, so you will not be able to move around other than walking within your play area to move slightly. The fixed positions are designed very badly with very little cover from some angles and literally none on other angles. Some positions have a much greater advantage, with enough cover to actually hide or a nice weapon. You'll find that in many positions, hiding isn't an option at all, so again its about who can spawn kill the other player the quickest.

If they'd change the positions and allow us to actually have cover and defense against spawn killing then it would actually be a fun game to be honest.

b) The holster thing is spotty at best. I know you want me to feel all-western but I'm in a chair and the guns are under the table, so I can't draw comfortably. Quickdraw doesn't work.
c) UI is weird. Guns draw a laser so you can point, but don't fire until the hidden timer expires on the curscene. No explanation on why guns just don't work. Feedback when they are unloaded is spotty. No alternative to reload revolvers other than the silly gesture that, if you can't perform for any reason, you can't play.

One would expect a few basic things in order before playing. Basic balance, minimal adjustments for people not playing 4 at a time, standing up, online, an option for people with bad wrists.

There isn't that much left, basically. Grabbing guns is not innovative (though having to hold tight for the duration kinda is, in a bad way). Reloading is cool but badly implemented.

I don't see how this is something you should get above any other game. Then again, it's free with Touch, so, I guess you get what you pay for.

review_title: Wow! So much more than I expected!
one_reviews_text:
Of all of the free games that came with my Oculus Rift, I really wasn't expecting too much from this game; how wrong I was! As soon as I jumped in to my first multi-player game, I realised this was so much more than a cartoony arcade shooter. Standing next to another player and being able to chat, fist bump and even fling playing cards at the other team before the round even began, had me grinning from ear to ear. 
Once the game got underway, I was seriously impressed with how immersive it quickly became. The duck and cover mechanics are fantastic as it literally converts your room into a scene from the wild west – it has you crawling, ducking, leaning and peaking around corners whilst being able to chat, taunt or just dance around with your fellow players.

The only thing (and this is by no means a negative) you’ll need a decent sized play space to fully enjoy all the game has to offer. It’ll no doubt have you sweating after your first game.

Overall a FANTASTIC game, with plenty of replayability. An absolute must have!

review_title: Exhilarating & best use of Touch so far
one_reviews_text:
Dead & Buried seems simple at first glance; a static shooter. But actually it's nothing like that. Firstly, it requires more player movement than anything else I've played in VR - it's definitely the most physically energetic game I've played yet - and secondly, the maps and gameplay are brilliantly balanced to make it continually varied and engaging. 
My playspace is about 2 metres across, and I use every inch of it playing this game. You might be crouching down behind a bunch of crates and peeking over to get some shots off, or dashing from one bit of cover at one end of your play space to another at the other end. The sense of presence in the gameworld is just amazing.
The gameplay is balanced via clever positioning of players - you move to another spot on the map when you get killed - and use of special weapons such as grenade launchers, three-shot rapid fire guns, bow and arrow or sniper rifle. This means that if someone has been spawned in a position with good cover, or at a long-range position with a rifle, you'll have various methods of dealing with them. It balances things out very well.
Horde mode is great fun too - the Witch boss feels like a World of Warcraft boss, and the developers have used some awesome visual and audio effects to enhance the experience.
Overall this is my single favourite title on Rift right now. Everything about it is polished, and the whole thing is just pure, if occasionally challenging, fun.

What would make it even better is if the developers added a "tutorial" for each multiplayer mode, so that you understand what's happening when you enter the arena. There are tutorials and practice rounds for the single player areas, so perhaps more are on there way?
Great game and a must have for your rift!

review_title: best game i played so far

Very good VR Game. 
For the next update or D&B2  I will move in and around the city/areas.

review_title: Would be better with SP modes

review_title: Great experience - Not for solo play
one_reviews_text: I think that this game plays very well. The twist action for the revolvers is fun. I run out of single player content very quickly. Grab a friend and this is a cool game.

game mostly requires teams and no one is ever on.  Devs need to allow play against AI as an option so you can at least practice
Probably the best oculus game there is right now!

review_title: Best Oculus game I've played so far
one_reviews_text:
The title says it all.
There's a lot of action in this one. VOIP throughout the multiplayer session makes it extra fun.
Two drawbacks at the moment: It can sometimes take a while to find a multiplayer game and due to my setup (one sensor is at the very end of my desk) the controllers sometimes lose tracking when I duck down on the floor (yes, you need to do that!!!)

I was blown away by the multiplayer experience this offered. Alot of cool parts for you and the other players to mess around with I've had some real funny moments on this game with other players. The gunplay is fun and variation of weapons keeps it interesting. A must have for sure!

Absolutely addictive gameplay. It feels finished and well put together with ample features, like leveling up for new costumes. I feel practice paying off, as I get better and better. The only thing missing here is a single player mode beyond target practice (boring) like solo survival mode. Depending on the hour of the day, it can take a while to find a match.

This is a really fun multiplayer experience, however it needs more players to excell.
I played with a few french people and shot a young kid to pieces :-) 
A nice example how multiplayer in a stationary (you can move a bit but you stay in your main area) environment can be fun.
Entertaining game, good shooter though no story, also quite reiant on multiplayer, but the gameplay with touch is great
Superb VR experience!   I can't believe it's free!

review_title: Great game when the multi-player works
one_reviews_text: Great game, loads of fun. Just one catch, actually have to find an online game. This game has the worst matchmaking I have seen since the 56k modem days. Lucky to find a game after 10-20 minutes, not including unable to connect to lobby error that seems to pop up alot.
I absolutly enjoyed every minute of this game.

review_title: Great fun, but you need to move!
one_reviews_text: I wouldn't have bought this game for £30, but obviously the free Touch Activation meant it was worth a look. After a short amount of time I can say it's very good fun; although if you struggle to move, dodge and duck immediately, you're gonna die, a lot. I died a lot (my back and knees aren't too good what with years of heavy/building work) because I couldn't find adequate cover quick enough, but I still had fun and managed to score a few kills. With a bit more time I'm sure I'll improve, and maybe I'll loosen up my aching back in the process! Thank you, Oculus, for this free game.

review_title: Best Rift/Touch experience so far by far
one_reviews_text:
Love playing this, its so involving. 
I started to play seated, but soon realised that youi 'need' to move around to hide behind crates etc.
Great fun shooting over the top of these barricades at other people.
This is simply the best experience so far, but its not without its issues...
My play area is small at 3'x4' (room 7'x7', but has desks and things in the way) and there are a few occasions when you have to pick up other weapons or open gates, which i cant do as they are out of my playing area.

This is the second VR title that has had me coming back for more. It's the first touch title that's really started to shoe the potential. You can make it work (mostly) in a small area, but a larger area would be better to avoid colliding with real world walls and furniture.
shootout is really miserable if you don't have adequate space to duck and cover, don't even try

review_title: best vr game for touch so far
one_reviews_text: Oh my god I was laughing so hard when I was playing this game I found myself in a shoot out with some french guy in a saloon we were both laughing and screaming with laughter trying to shoot each other really well done an absolute must have at the end we were doing a dance off think I won it was hilarius
It's and amazing game and it's free!
I just wish there were actual 7-12 hour campaign games.
Love this game, can't get enough. The aiming and shooting is on point and the other guns only make it better. The small required area is a big bonus too.

There are so many reasons to love this game. The different modes are diverse and very entertaining. From cooperative wave shooting to trying for a high score in target practice to a 1v1 quick draw duel, and more. 

Very good fun from a very well polished game!

Loving this game. It's not bug free, but for the most part they don't detract from an awesome Touch play session, and everyone is super-friendly. The games are a good mixture of the same format, so you can get quite good quite quickly without it actually becoming too repetitive. 
Can't wait to see what future patches bring to this.

review_title: the action FPS for VR I wanted
one_reviews_text: I wanted something I could go to and replace the fast-paced FPS's we currently have. This might be it. Action is quick and extremely skill based. Will make you sweat with the phsyical demands. Only gripes are related to balance, use of cover being questionable at times, and absolutely horrific match making since launch. With a few tweaks/updates this could surpass superhot as the greatest action VR experience on any platform.
Love it!

Having both a Vive and Oculus I've played a lot of titles.  From Space Pirate Trainer to Hover Junkers.  This is the most fun I've had so far and keep coming back.  Enough modes to keep you interested and some unlocks as well.

This game deserves the positve feedback it's getting. There are few downsides except that there is not enough playing to quickly find a match sometimes. Good game modes, Quick draw is fun, shootout is also fun, Every mode is fun. Space is definitely an advantage in this game though, but if you don't have a lot it's still doable. Simple but fun, hopefully they will make more content,  as more diversity is always welcome.

This is a PvP or coop-experience that really focuses on what's important. There are the very short and focused quickdraw duels, the longer shootouts that provide cover (and will destroy your knees if you don't have kneepads), the even longer horde coop mode and even a mode that's similar to Assault for those who used to play UT back in the day. Very good implementation of the shooter game type.

review_title: Best touch shooter out so far

Dead and Buried with the Touch controllers changed everything.  I've been playing the game every single night since I got it.  Touch is what Oculus needed. review_title: great fun but needs more options
one_reviews_text:
This game is great, but I feel as if they are holding back.

first of, it needs some singleplayer mode. because let's be honest here, multiplayer in VR is bound to fail as more and more games will get released.
unless the game is really really good the playerbase will drop.
SP is also needed just for having some solofun, to just relax a bit.

2nd, it needs to be more playerfriendly. For example, when i choose a mode and go for quickplay, it will go for a round of that mode but after that it just goes random.
3rd, it needs more content. as in more guns, skins, ...

The idea and the content that's there is really great, but it's not gonna be enough to survive

There is a good amount of content here and it's all really fun. Surprisingly the 2v2 pvp mode isn't my favorite (though it's still a ton of fun). Horde mode and quick draw currently have my attention and there is also a Robbery mode that I have not been able to try but it sounds fun as well.

Needs more players online though!

When I was a kid and went to play laser tag with my friends, I always walked out thinking: That was cool but it never felt real.

Dead & Buried makes it really feel like you're in a gunbattle. The shooting and re-loading mechanics are dead on. And ducking and crouching and sometimes crawling behind cover is a great work out.

Needs more match options and maps, but it's early. Also there's no single-player campaign mode.
super multiplayer+shoot mechanick+free=very cool game

review_title: ok single player and great Multi player

review_title: An amazing game with tons of modes

without players. have been waiting in matchmaking for tooo long time. at this moment only more sinlgeplayer action could be the key of succes. it`s a shame because the games is fantastic!

review_title: Great Game, but some technical issues.

Matchmaking woes can kill a game if it FEELS like no one is playing, even if they are.

This is the first actual 'normal' game that has actually blown me away, so apart from iRacing, PCars and Elite which I class as more sims, this is amazing fun playing the quick draw with 4 other players like a wild west shoot out, amazing. Won my first 3 complete rounds on it, love it!

2vs2 is amazing. It's really fast-paced, the feel of danger is in and high-fiving your teammate as stupid as it sounds is a pretty amazing new thing. Definitely worth the play. 

Do hydrate though, things can get sweaty.

Awesome production value. Great user interface. Fun shooting. PVP and COOP.  It feels like the old school lightgun games I played in the Arcades as a kid. Except now you are in the game. Fantastic. Oculus Studios are knocking it out of the park well done guys.
